title: Sophie, Countess of Wessex, weeps as she remembers Duke of Edinburgh
description: Sophie, Countess of Wessex, tells 5 Live about the "giant-sized hole" the Duke of Edinburgh’s death has left in the Royal family.

title: Iran election: Who will voters choose as president?
description: Seven men are competing to become president but most reformist and centrist candidates are barred from standing.

title: Drone cameras record social lives of killer whales
description: A new study suggests killer whales may socialise with each other based on age and gender.

title: What are the Delta variant symptoms?
description: The Delta variant of Covid-19, first identified in India, has changed how the virus is spreading.

title: Mother designs cards for babies of colour due to 'lack of representation'
description: Deborah Ajaja struggled to find milestone cards that matched her child’s heritage, so she created her own.

title: Euro 2020: Watch 'superstar' Ronaldo's historic double for Portugal
description: Portugal's Cristiano Ronaldo makes history by becoming the all-time leading goalscorer in the European Championship after scoring a brace versus Hungary in front of a capacity crowd in Budapest.

title: E3 2021: Nintendo shows off more Zelda Breath of the Wild 2
description: A last-minute Zelda segment capped a Nintendo showcase which left some fans disappointed.

title: US-Russia relations: Adversary or potential partner?
description: Three young Americans and three young Russians spoke to the BBC about the other country.

title: Isles of Scilly: Egyptian vulture seen in UK for first time in 150 years
description: The sighting of the Egyptian vulture, if confirmed to be wild, would be the first for 153 years.

title: Covid: PM insists July unlocking will go ahead in England
description: But scientists warn a rise in deaths could derail the plan, and some MPs fear a further delay.

title: Ex-BBC boss Tony Hall: Wrong not to sack Bashir after Diana interview
description: Former director general Tony Hall says of Martin Bashir: "We trusted him, and we... shouldn't have."

title: Daniel Morgan: Met Police accused of corruption in report
description: Daniel Morgan, a private investigator, was found dead in a pub car park with an axe in his head.

title: Goalkeeper Ramsdale replaces injured Henderson in England's Euro 2020 squad
description: Goalkeeper Aaron Ramsdale is called up to England's Euro 2020 squad to replace injured Dean Henderson.

title: Apple and Google investigated by UK competition body
description: The UK competition authority says it has launched an investigation into the mobile phone market.

title: UK-Australia trade deal: What are the arguments for and against?
description: The government has agreed the broad terms of a trade deal with Australia.

title: Ikea France fined €1m for snooping on staff
description: The ex-CEO of Ikea France gets a suspended term, as private detectives and police spied on staff.

title: UK and Australia in first post-Brexit trade deal
description: The pact - the first built from scratch since leaving the EU - includes Scotch whisky and biscuits.

title: Web founder Berners-Lee to auction source code as NFT
description: Sir Tim Berners-Lee, creator of the web, is auctioning off a digital certificate for his code.

title: Record rise in workers on payrolls in May
description: The number of people in payrolled jobs jumped by almost 200,000 in May as the jobs market continued to recover.

title: 'Eating pork can lead to a false positive' - US runner blames burrito for four-year ban
description: Shelby Houlihan says she has been banned for four years after testing positive for a prohibited substance - which she blames on a burrito.

title: In The Heights: Lin-Manuel Miranda sorry for lack of Afro-Latinos
description: In The Heights creator Lin-Manuel Miranda says his film "fell short" in the diversity of its cast.

title: South Africa: Unidentified stones spark hopes of a diamond rush
description: Many of those digging in KwaHlathi village in South Africa believe the stones are precious jewels.

title: Maisie Peters: Meet the singer who's been snapped up by Ed Sheeran
description: Get to know the 21-year-old whose debut album will be coming out on Ed Sheeran's record label.

title: Christian Eriksen 'fine under circumstances' after cardiac arrest at Euro 2020
description: Denmark midfielder Christian Eriksen says he is "fine under the circumstances" as he continues his recovery from a cardiac arrest.

title: Pro14 renamed United Rugby Championship as South African quartet join for 2021-22 season
description: South Africa's four Super Rugby teams will join the Pro14, with the league renamed the United Rugby Championship.

title: Rare orchids found in City of London bank's rooftop garden
description: Usually seen in southern Europe, the plants have not been found in the wild in the UK for decades.

title: From teenage tears to European champion: How Cristiano Ronaldo became a Euros legend
description: BBC Sport looks at Cristiano Ronaldo's journey at the European Championship, from teenage tears in 2004 against Greece, all the way through to winning the tournament as Portugal's captain at Euro 2016.

title: The Papers: 'Will we ever be free?' and 'vax to the future'
description: The decision to delay lifting the last coronavirus restrictions in England dominates Tuesday's papers.

title: The 'visual beauty' of bricked-up windows
description: Andy Billman's architectural photo series examines how light and air affect wellbeing.
